billingServer
Class BillingServer

java.lang.Object
  billingServer.BillingServer
All Implemented Interfaces:
BillingServerInterface, java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote
public class BillingServer
extends java.lang.Object
implements BillingServerInterface, java.io.Serializable

This is the class for the user login. If the login is successfully, you will get an reference to the BillingServerSecure Object which provides you other methods

Version:
1.1
Author:
Klune Alexander, Tobias Lins

Method Detail

login

public BillingServerSecureInterface login(java.lang.String username,
                                          java.lang.String password)
                                   throws UserInputException
The access to the billing server is secured by user authentication. To keep things simple, the username/password combinations can be configured statically in a config file user.properties. Each line in this file contains an entry " = ", e.g., "john = f23c5f9779a3804d586f4e73178e4ef0". Do not put plain-text passwords into the config file, but store the MD5 hash (not very safe either, but sufficient for this assignment) of the passwords. Use the java.security.MessageDigest class to obtain the MD5 hash of a given password. If and only if the login information is correct, the management client obtains a reference to a SecureBillingServer remote object, which performs the actual tasks.

Specified by:
login in interface BillingServerInterface
Parameters:
username - username of the user login
password - password from this user
Returns:
reference von BillingServerSecure
Throws:
UserInputException
